author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 32-year-lorry driver from Nallapanaikanur, near Pochampalli, was murdered by an unidentified gang in Madhya Pradesh on March 16.

Another driver, who accompanied him, also suffered injuries and was hospitalised.

Subramani and Rajesh (27) of Sendurai were lorry drivers working for a private road lines in Tiruchengode in Namakkal district.

On March 11, they left to Pantnagar in Madhya Pradesh in the lorry with load. While returning, the lorry was loaded with groundnut and it was on its way to Chennai.

Subramani was on the wheels while Rajesh was sitting near him. After leaving Pantnagar, an unidentified gang that was following them intercepted the lorry and beat Rajesh.

They fired at Subramani who died on the spot. With vehicles plying on the road, the gang fled the scene.

Later, Rajesh became conscious and reached the nearby tollgate.

The police was informed who rushed to the spot and sent the body to hospital in Pantnagar. Rajesh was also admitted to the same hospital and was recovering.

Rajesh informed Subramani’s family through phone on Thursday. Subramani is survived by wife Selvi (28) and two children in the age of 11 and 9 years.
title: Lorry driver murdered in Madhya Pradesh
